Altimetry: The measurement of height or altitude.
Digital Elevation Model: Digital Elevation Model (DEM)  is a 3D CG representation of a terrain's surface. which are arrays of regularly spaced elevation values referenced horizontally either to a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) projection or to a geographic coordinate system.
Light Detection And Ranging (LiDAR): A surveying method that measures distance to a target by illuminating the target with laser light and measuring the reflected light with a sensor.
Photogrammetric: The process of making maps or scale drawings from photographs, especially aerial photography.
Topographic Map Interpolation: The process of drawing contour lines by inferring their plan position and trend from spot levels or from other contours, assuming the intervening ground to have uniform slope.
Trigonometric Leveling: The branch of Surveying in which to determine the vertical distance between two points by taking the vertical angular observations and the known distances. The known distances are either assumed to be horizontal or the geodetic lengths at the mean sea level(MSL)
